dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 1281 IH: Skills First Act of 2015
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Carney introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Education and the Workforce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To increase the number of months of vocational educational training that may be counted as work under the temporary assistance for needy families program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Skills First Act of 2015.

section.header: Increase in number of months of vocational educational training that may be counted as work

subsection.text: Section 407(d)(8) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 607(d)(8)) is amended by striking 12 and inserting 36.
The amendment made by this section shall take effect on the first day of the first calendar month that begins after the date that is 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.
